name: WP Hashgrid
author: Morgan Estes

sections.description: This plugin uses the hashgrid.js script to overlay a CSS-customizable grid.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the wp-hashgrid folder and contents to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the 'Plugins' menu in WordPress.
  3. Press the assigned hotkeys when viewing your website to display the grid.
sections.changelog:
0.1.2

  • Removed PHP4-style call to $this.

0.1.1

  • Compatibility with 3.6 confirmed.

0.1.0

  • Initial release using hashgrid.js version 9.
sections.faq:
How do I customize the grid?

Use your favorite editor to change the hashgrid.css file inside the plugin folder.

What keys do I press to see the grid?

See http://hashgrid.com/#usage for the default keys.

Can I customize the hotkeys and grid layout from the Admin page?

Not yet, but that's coming next. If you want to customize the keys, follow the instructions listed in the hashgrid.js file in the plugin. Keep in mind that future releases of the plugin may override your custom settings when you upgrade.
sections.other_notes:
Credits

The hashgrid.js script was created by Analog and is licensed under Apache 2.0. Follow along at https://github.com/dotjay/hashgrid.

short_description: Overlay a customizable grid over your site to help with design layout using the `hashgrid.js` library.
